triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control problems in multiagent systems composed of multiple interacting intelligent agents.

triples.name: Neural network (machine learning)
triples.relevance: Neural networks are used to approximate the unknown nonlinear functions of the multiagent systems.

triples.name: Directed graph
triples.relevance: Directed graphs represent the communication topology and interconnections between agents in the multiagent system.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: Adaptive control techniques are employed to handle uncertain parameters and adapt to system variations in real-time.

triples.name: Backstepping
triples.relevance: Backstepping is a recursive nonlinear control technique used in the proposed control scheme to stabilize the system.

triples.name: Nonlinear control
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control of nonlinear multiagent systems, requiring nonlinear control theory techniques.

triples.name: Lyapunov stability
triples.relevance: Lyapunov stability theory is employed through a novel finite-time stability criterion to prove closed-loop system stability.

triples.name: Consensus dynamics
triples.relevance: The paper addresses consensus tracking problem where agents reach agreement on a common tracking objective.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Control theory provides the mathematical foundation for designing the event-triggered control scheme.

triples.name: Event-driven architecture
triples.relevance: An event-triggered control mechanism with dynamic threshold is proposed to reduce network resource waste.
